org.powermock.examples.dom4j

Class AbstractXMLRequestCreatorBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.powermock.examples.dom4j.AbstractXMLRequestCreatorBase

  • public abstract class AbstractXMLRequestCreatorBase
extends java.lang.Object
    A base class that may be inherited by request creators that implement IRequestCreator to create xml requests (that should be parsed to byte[] data).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractXMLRequestCreatorBase() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

      byte[] convertDocumentToByteArray(org.dom4j.Document document)
      Convert a dom4j xml document to a byte[].
      protected abstract void createBody(org.dom4j.Element body, java.lang.String... parameters)
      Subclasses should implement this method to add the body content of the request.
      byte[] createRequest(java.lang.String... params)

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractXMLRequestCreatorBase

    • Method Detail

      • convertDocumentToByteArray

        public byte[] convertDocumentToByteArray(org.dom4j.Document document)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Convert a dom4j xml document to a byte[].
        Parameters:
        document - The document to convert.
        Returns:
        A byte[] representation of the xml document.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an exception occurs when converting the document.

      • createRequest

        public final byte[] createRequest(java.lang.String... params)

      • createBody

        protected abstract void createBody(org.dom4j.Element body,
                                   java.lang.String... parameters)
        Subclasses should implement this method to add the body content of the request.
        Parameters:
        body - The message body. Subclasses should append new elements to this body.
        parameters - Parameters that may be used when creating the request, for example the ID of the request. May be null if that's appropriate for a specific request creator.
